results.firPara: The FA want to double the number of girls and women taking part in football to nearly six million by 2020. But will the ambitious new strategy work?
results.secPara: Last Monday the FA announced a new Gameplan for Growth plan in an attempt to strengthen womens football in the UK. Focus will be on developing talent and infrastructure, increasing the number and diversity of womens coaches, referees and administrators and changing perceptions and social barriers to taking part. Enhancing the profile and value of the England team and improving the commercial prospects of womens football has also been highlighted.
results.webTitle: 'Women’s football needs to stand on its own' - readers on the FA's new plans

results.firPara: Todays tittle-tattle is counting its change
results.secPara: Todays tittle-tattle is counting its change
results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: Gylfi Sigurdsson to Everton?

results.firPara: The decay is palpable and delaying an awkward decision for so long has made the club less attractive to potential successors to the Frenchman
results.secPara: On Arsène Wenger, everything is divided, even the news. Just as Bild was reporting there has been contact between representatives of Arsenal and the Borussia Dortmund coach, Thomas Tuchel – no great shock given recent uncertainty but an indication the board is perhaps not quite so supine as it can at times seem – so it was emerging the decision Wenger trailed after Saturdays defeat by West Bromwich Albion is that he wishes to stay. The handful of people in Britain qualified to fly planes dragging banners must be delighted.
results.webTitle: Arsenal require major surgery whether Arsène Wenger stays or goes | Jonathan Wilson

results.firPara: Jürgen Klopp has revealed his exasperation over Chris Colemans decision to call up Liverpools Ben Woodburn to the Wales squad.
results.secPara: The 17-year-old striker, who was an unused substitute at the Etihad Stadium on Sunday where Liverpool drew 1-1 with Manchester City, has played for the Wales Under-19s and was propelled into the senior squad by Coleman following only seven first-team appearances at club level.
results.webTitle: Jürgen Klopp fumes at Chris Coleman over Ben Woodburn’s Wales call-up

results.firPara: Rio Ferdinand has opened up on the helplessness and pain he felt after the death of his wife, Rebecca. The former Manchester United defender revealed that without his wife or a football club to lean on, he didnt have a clue how to make a doctors appointment.
results.secPara: Ferdinand has also spoken of how difficult he found coping with being a single parent to his three children after he lost Rebecca to cancer in 2015. His sons, Lorenz and Tate, were then nine and six and his daughter, Tia, was four.
results.webTitle: Rio Ferdinand talks of pain and helplessness after wife’s death

results.firPara: Jamie Vardy has claimed he received death threats because of his alleged involvement in the dressing-room mutiny that undermined Claudio Ranieri and said the backlash against the players who won the Premier League title with Leicester City last season has led to his family suffering a number of terrifying ordeals.
results.secPara: Vardy denied he had been responsible in any way for Ranieris sacking but admitted the incident had crystallised the impression of him as someone football fans dont seem to like. He said the repercussions had also threatened his familys safety, featuring a number of alleged road-rage incidents involving his wife, Rebekah, as the victim.
results.webTitle: Jamie Vardy: I got death threats over Claudio Ranieri sacking at Leicester

results.firPara: Olivier Giroud believes the Arsenal players are right behind manager Arsène Wenger and want him to stay on at the club despite mounting fan unrest and a poor run of form.
results.secPara: Wenger is determined to continue and, with a two-year contract on the table, says an announcement will be made very soon.
results.webTitle: Olivier Giroud: Arsenal players want Arsène Wenger to stay on

results.firPara: The League of Ireland was in shock on Monday over the sudden death of the captain of Derry City at the age of 27. Ryan McBride was found dead at his home in Derry on Sunday evening. The cause is unknown. As a mark of respect all first round EA Sports Cup games due to be played on Tuesday have been postponed.
results.secPara: McBride passed away 24 hours after captaining Derry to victory over Drogheda United, the clubs fourth straight league win this season. The previous week McBride scored the winner against Shamrock Rovers and was regarded as one of the most talented players in the league. He came from the Brandywell district of Derry where the clubs ground is based.
results.webTitle: Cup games postponed after Derry City captain Ryan McBride dies aged 27

results.firPara: Today International Day of Happiness v International International Week of Unhappiness, politically populist David Moyes and more

results.firPara: A 3-1 scoreline was flattering to the losers and a run of four games without a win in all competitions encapsulates a season threatening to end prematurely
results.secPara: They were enjoying this down by the river, singing along in the spring sunshine. Diego Simeone led them through the chorus of Cant Take My Eyes Off Of You dedicated to Fernando Torres, The Kid who is 33 on Monday and who had come on this time unlike the last, finally returning from that head injury, and they swiftly followed by chanting at Cholo too.
results.webTitle: Diego Simeone's Atlético Madrid give Sevilla a Father's Day to forget | Sid Lowe
